RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_PI
RegisterGroup.description: a port implementation register.

Member.name: port_imp
Member.description:
Port validity indicator. If the value is 0xF, four ports (ports 0?3) are valid. Bits 3?0 correspond to ports 3?0 respectively.
0: The ports are invalid.
1: The ports are valid.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_VS
RegisterGroup.description: an AHCI version identifier register.

Member.name: achi_vs
Member.description: AHCI V1.3 is supported.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_CCC_CTL
RegisterGroup.description: a CCC control register.

Member.name: ccc_tv
Member.description:
CCC timeout parameter (in ms).
When the CCC function is enabled, the timeout counter loads this parameter value. If a command is executed on a port involved in CCC counting, the counter decreases by 1 every 1 ms until a CCC interrupt is generated when the counter reaches 0. Then the counter reloads the parameter value for the next counting.
Note that this field cannot be set to 0.

Member.name: ccc_cc
Member.description:
CCC command completion upper threshold.
When the CCC function is enabled, the counter is cleared after commands are executed. The counter starts to count the number of completed commands on the ports involved in CCC counting. If the count value is greater than or equal to the parameter value, a CCC interrupt is generated. Then the counter is cleared again for the next counting.
If value 0 is written to this field, the command completion interrupt is disabled, and the CCC interrupt is generated only when timeout occurs.

Member.name: ccc_int
Member.description: CCC interrupt vector ID. If the value is 0x1F (31), SATA_GHC_IS bit[31] indicates the CCC interrupt status.

Member.name: ccc_en
Member.description:
CCC function enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
When the CCC function is enabled, the values of ccc_tv and ccc_cc cannot be changed.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_CCC_PORTS
RegisterGroup.description: the CCC port enable register.

Member.name: ccc_prt
Member.description:
Ports involved in CCC counting. Bits 3?0 correspond to ports 3?0 respectively. If the related bit is 1, the port is involved in CCC counting. If the related bit is 0, the port is not involved in CCC counting.
The value of this register can be changed at any time and the changed value takes effect immediately.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_CAP2
RegisterGroup.description: feature support register 2.

Member.name: cap_boh
Member.description: Fixed at 1, indicating that BIOS/OS handoff control is supported.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_BOHC
RegisterGroup.description: a BIOS/OS handoff control register.

Member.name: bohc_bb
Member.description:
BIOS status indicator.
0: The BIOS is not busy.
1: The BIOS is busy in performing certain operations and is ready to hand the control rights off to the OS.

Member.name: bohc_ooc
Member.description: When the value of bohc_oos is changed from 0 to 1, this bit is fixed at 1. Writing 1 clears this bit and writing 0 has no effect.

Member.name: bohc_sooe
Member.description:
Message interrupt enable.
0: No message interrupt is generated.
1: When bohc_ooc is set to 1, a message interrupt is generated.

Member.name: bohc_oos
Member.description:
Request applied by the OS for controlling the controller.
0: The OS does not apply for the control permission on the controller.
1: The OS applies for the control permission on the controller. If bohc_oos is 1 and bios_bos is 0, the OS has obtained the control permission on the SATA controller. Resetting the SATA controller by setting SATA_GHC_GHC[hab_rst] has no effect on this bit.

Member.name: bohc_bos
Member.description:
Indicator of the control permission on the controller for the BIOS.
0: The BIOS does not have the control permission on the controller.
1: The BIOS has the control permission on the controller. If the OS applies for the permission on the controller, the BIOS clears this bit. Resetting the SATA controller by setting SATA_GHC_GHC[hab_rst] has no effect on this bit.

Spread spectrum clocking shifting.

Member.description:
Clock frequency offset when ssc_en is valid.
000: ?4980
001: ?4492
010: ?4003
011: ?2000
100: +4980
101: +4492
110: +4003
111: +2000
Note: This field is valid only for the Synopsys controller.

Member.description: Base address for storing the port command list in the memory. Resetting the SATA controller by configuring SATA_GHC_GHC[hab_rst] has no effect on this field.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_FB
RegisterGroup.description: an RX FIS base address register.

Member.name: port_fb
Member.description: Base address in the memory for storing the frames received over the port. Resetting the SATA controller by configuring SATA_GHC_GHC[hab_rst] has no effect on this field.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_IS
RegisterGroup.description: a port interrupt status register.

Member.name: pxis_tfes
Member.description:
Task file data (TFD) error interrupt status.
0: The ERR bit in SATA_PORT_TFD[tfd_sts] is not 1.
1: The ERR bit in SATA_PORT_TFD[tfd_sts] is 1.

Member.name: pxis_hbds
Member.description:
Internal bus error interrupt.
0: The DMAC accesses the memory properly.
1: An error occurs when the DMAC accesses the memory.

Member.name: pxis_ifs
Member.description:
Fatal error interrupt status.
0: No error occurs during the data frame transfer.
1: An error occurs during the data frame transfer.

Member.name: pxis_infs
Member.description:
Non-fatal error interrupt status.
0: No error occurs during the non-data frame transfer.
1: An error occurs during the non-data frame transfer.

Member.name: pxis_ofs
Member.description:
Data transfer overflow interrupt status.
0: No overflow is detected.
1: During the data frame transfer, if the size of the data memory occupied by commands is smaller than the actual data amount, an interrupt is reported at the end of the data transfer.

Member.name: pxis_ipms
Member.description:
PM port number error interrupt status.
0: No PM port ID error is detected during data receive.
1: A PM port ID error is detected during data receive.

Member.name: pxis_prcs
Member.description:
PHY state change interrupt status.
0: No changes of the phyrdy signals are detected.
1: The changes of the phyrdy signals are detected.
This bit directly reflects the value of SATA_PORT_SERR[diag_n].

Member.name: pxis_pcs
Member.description:
Port connection change interrupt status.
0: No COMINIT signal transmitted from the device is detected.
1: A COMINIT signal transmitted from the device is detected.
This bit directly reflects the value of SATA_PORT_SERR[diag.x].

Member.name: pxis_dps
Member.description:
Linked list transfer completion interrupt status.
0: The transfer of the linked list data without PRD "I = 1" is complete.
1: The transfer of the linked list data with PRD "I = 1" is complete.

Member.name: pxis_ufs
Member.description:
Unknown FIS interrupt status.
0: No unknown FIS is received.
1: An unknown FIS is received.

Member.name: pxis_sdbs
Member.description:
Set device bits FIS interrupt status.
0: This bit is meaningless.
1: A set device bits FIS is received and the I bit is 1.

Member.name: pxis_dss
Member.description:
DMA setup FIS interrupt status.
0: This bit is meaningless.
1: A DMA setup FIS is received and the I bit is 1.

Member.name: pxis_pss
Member.description:
PIO setup FIS interrupt status.
0: This bit is meaningless.
1: A PIO setup FIS is received and the I bit is 1.

Member.name: pxis_drhs
Member.description:
D2H register FIS interrupt status.
0: This bit is meaningless.
1: A D2H register FIS is received and the I bit is 1.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_CMD
RegisterGroup.description: a port command and status register.

Member.name: cmd_icc
Member.description:
Port communications control signal.
0x0: no operation. It indicates that the next port state request is allowed.
0x1: request for enabling the port to enter the active state
0x2: request for enabling the port to enter the partial state
0x6: request for enabling the port to enter in the slumber state
Other values: reserved
When software writes any of the preceding values rather than the reserved values, the controller clears the cmd_icc bit after performing related operations. When software requests the current state of the port, the controller clears the cmd_icc bit directly. If software requests the port state change from a low-power state to another lower-power state, for example, from the partial state to the slumber state, it needs to request the state change from the partial state to the active state, and then to the slumber state.

Member.name: cmd_asp
Member.description:
Slumber or partial state select for power management.
0: If ALPes is set to 1, the HBA enters the partial state.
1: If ALPes is set to 1, the HBA enters the slumber state.

Member.name: cmd_alpe
Member.description:
Automatic power management enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled. If SATA_PORT_CI and SATA_PORT_SACT are cleared, the controller automatically enters the power-management state. If cmd_asp is 1, the controller enters the partial state; if cmd_asp is 0, the controller enters the slumber state.

Member.name: cmd_dlae
Member.description:
LED drive enable in ATAPI mode.
0: The LED pin can be driven when cmd_atapi is 0 and commands are being executed.
1: The LED pin can be driven when commands are being executed.

Member.name: cmd_atapi
Member.description:
ATAPI device indicator.
0: The current device is not an ATAPI device.
1: The current device is an ATAPI device.

Member.name: fbscp
Member.description:
Whether the port supports FIS-based switching. When SATA_GHC_CAP1[spm] and SATA_GHC_CAP1[FBSS] are set to 1, this bit must be set to 1.
0: not supported
1: supported

Member.name: cmd_esp
Member.description: Fixed at 1, indicating that the eSATA device is supported.

Member.name: cmd_pma
Member.description:
PM detection indicator.
0: No PM connects to the port.
1: A PM connects to the port.

Member.name: cmd_cr
Member.description:
Command list processing indicator.
0: No command is being executed.
1: A command is being executed.

Member.name: cmd_fr
Member.description:
FIS RX processing indicator.
0: No FIS can be received.
1: FISs can be received.

Member.name: cmd_ccs
Member.description:
Slot number of the current command.
This field valid when cmd_st is 1 and is cleared when cmd_st is 0.

Member.name: cmd_fre
Member.description:
FIS RX enable control.
0: The received FISs cannot be written to the system memory.
1: FISs can be received and written to the system memory.
Software needs to set the RX FIS base address register SATA_PORT_FB before enabling this bit to receive FISs. When cmd_st is 1, this bit must be set to 1.

Member.name: cmd_clo
Member.description:
BSY/DQR clear control. Software can forcibly clear the BSY and DRQ bits by configuring the cmd_clo bit and transmit commands to the device.
0: no effect
1: The BSY and DRQ bits in SATA_PORT_TFD[tfd_sts] are cleared. After the BSY and DRQ bits are 0, the cmd_clo bit is automatically cleared.
The cmd_clo bit can be written as 1 only before the value of cmd_st is changed from 0 to 1. Software must write 1 to cmd_st after the cmd_clo bit is cleared.

Member.name: cmd_sud
Member.description:
Spin-up device control.
0: When SATA_PORT_SCTL[det] is 0, the controller enters the listen mode.
1: After the system is powered on or the HBA is reset, the controller is enabled to transmit a COMRESET sequence to initialize the hard disk.

Member.name: cmd_st
Member.description:
Command list processing enable.
0: The controller becomes idle.
1: The controller processes the commands from slot 0 that are identified as valid slots by SATA_PORT_CI.
Note: The cmd_st bit can be set to 1 only after cmd_fre is 1.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_TFD
RegisterGroup.description: a port task file register.

Member.name: tfd_err
Member.description:
Task file error register value.
The controller updates this field after receiving a D2H register FIS, a PIO setup FIS, or an SDB FIS.

Member.name: tfd_sts
Member.description:
Task file status register value.
bit[7]: BSY bit. It indicates that the device is busy.
bit[6:4]: The meaning of these bits varies according to commands.
bit[3]: DRQ bit. It indicates that there is the data to be transferred in the device.
bit[2:1]: The meaning of these bits varies according to commands.
bit[0]: bit[0]: ERR bit. It indicates that an error occurs during data transfer.
The controller updates this field after receiving a D2H register FIS, a PIO setup FIS, or an SDB FIS.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SIG
RegisterGroup.description: a port signature register.

Member.name: signature
Member.description:
LBA address and sector addressing. The allocated addresses are as follows:
bit[31:24]: LBA upper-bit address
bit[23:16]: LBA middle-bit address
bit[15:8]: LBA lower-bit address
bit[7:0]: number of sectors
The controller updates this register when receiving the first D2H register FIS after the hard disk is reset.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SSTS
RegisterGroup.description: a port status register.

Member.name: pxssts_ipm
Member.description:
Current port status.
0x0: There is no device or no communication is set up.
0x1: active
0x2: partial
0x6: slumber
Other values: reserved

Member.name: pxssts_spd
Member.description:
Port negotiation speed status.
0x0: There is no device or no communication is set up.
0x1: Rate 1 is selected during negotiation for communication.
0x2: Rate 2 is selected during negotiation for communication.
0x3: Rate 3 is selected during negotiation for communication.
Other values: reserved

Member.name: pxssts_det
Member.description:
Device detection and PHY status.
0x0: No device is detected and no PHY communication is set up.
0x1: A device is detected but no PHY communication is set up.
0x3: A device is detected but the PHY communication is set up.
0x4: The PHY is offline or in the built in self test (BIST) state.
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SCTL
RegisterGroup.description: a port control register.

Member.name: pxsctl_ipm
Member.description:
Port power management status control.
0x0: There is no special requirement.
0x1: The port is not allowed to enter the partial state.
0x2: The port is not allowed to enter the slumber state.
0x3: The port is not allowed to enter the partial or slumber state.
Other values: reserved

Member.name: pxsctl_spd
Member.description:
Port communications speed control.
0x0: There is no special requirement.
0x1: The communication rate is limited to rate 1.
0x2: The communication rate is limited to rate 2.
0x3: The communication rate is limited to rate 3.
Other values: reserved

Member.name: pxsctl_det
Member.description:
Device detection and port initialization control.
0x0: There is no device detection or initialization request.
0x1: The port is requested to reset the initialization sequence COMRESET.
0x4: The port is forced to enter the offline state.
Other values: reserved
When pxsctl_det is set to 1, the controller transmits the COMRESET sequence to the device. In this case, software must retain the value of pxsctl_det for at least 1 ms, ensuring that the device receives the COMRESET sequence.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SERR
RegisterGroup.description: an error diagnosis status register.

Member.name: diag_x
Member.description:
Device detection status.
0: No COMINIT signal transmitted from the device is detected.
1: A COMINIT signal transmitted from the device is detected.

Member.name: diag_f
Member.description:
Detection status of the unknown FIS.
0: No unknown FIS is received.
1: An unknown FIS is received and the cyclic redundancy check (CRC) is correct.

Member.name: diag_s
Member.description:
Link layer error status.
0: No state transition error occurs at the link layer.
1: A state transition error occurs at the link layer.

Member.name: diag_h
Member.description:
Handshake error status.
0: No R_ERR primitive transmitted from the device is received.
1: One or more R_ERR primitives transmitted from the device are received.

Member.name: diag_c
Member.description:
CRC error status.
0: No CRC error occurs during FIS reception.
1: A CRC error occurs during FIS reception.

Member.name: diag_b
Member.description:
Decoding error status.
0: No 8B/10B decoding error is detected.
1: An 8B/10B decoding error is detected.

Member.name: diag_w
Member.description:
COMWAKE status.
0: No COMWAKE signal transmitted from the device is detected.
1: A COMWAKE signal transmitted from the device is detected.

Member.name: diag_i
Member.description:
PHY internal error status.
0: No PHY internal error is detected.
1: A PHY internal error is detected.

Member.name: diag_n
Member.description:
PhyRdy signal change status.
0: The PhyRdy signal is not changed.
1: The PhyRdy signal is changed.
This bit is set to 1 when the value of the PhyRdy signal is changed from 1 to 0 or from 0 to 1.

Member.name: err_p
Member.description:
SATA protocol incompliance error status.
0: All device behaviors comply with the SATA protocol.
1: Certain device behaviors do not comply with the SATA protocol.

Member.name: err_t
Member.description:
Data integrity error status.
0: No data integrity error is detected.
1: A data integrity error is detected.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SACT
RegisterGroup.description: an NCQ command identifier control register.

Member.name: port_sact
Member.description:
NCQ command identifier control.
Each bit of this register corresponds to a tag ID and an NCQ command in the memory. To be specific, bit[31:0] correspond to the commands of slots 31–0 and tags 31–0 respectively. The following describes the meaning of each bit by taking bit 3 as an example:
0: The slot 3 command is a non-NCQ command.
1: The slot 3 command is an NCQ command. Before setting SATA_PORT_CI bit[3] to 1, software must set SATA_PORT_SACT bit[3] to 1. After the command data transfer, the device transmits an SDB FIS. Then the controller clears SATA_PORT_SACT bit[3] based on the SActive in the FIS.
Software can set SATA_PORT_SACT only when cmd_st is 1. When cmd_st is 0, all bits of SATA_PORT_SACT are cleared.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_CI
RegisterGroup.description: a command TX control register.

Member.name: port_ci
Member.description:
Control for the commands to be transmitted.
Each bit of this register corresponds to a command in the memory. To be specific, bit[31:0] correspond to the commands of slots 31–0 respectively. The following describes the meaning of each bit by taking bit 3 as an example:
0: There is no slot 3 command to be transmitted and executed.
1: A slot 3 command is created in the memory. Then the controller can transmit this command. After running this command and receiving a corresponding FIS, the controller clears SATA_PORT_CI bit[3] and the BSY, DRQ, and ERR bits in SATA_PORT_TFD.
The bits in SATA_PORT_CI can be set to 1 only when cmd_st is 1, and all bits in SATA_PORT_CI are cleared when cmd_st is 0.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SNTF
RegisterGroup.description: an async notification event indicator register.

Member.name: pxsntf_pmn
Member.description:
Async notification event status.
If the controller receives an SDB FIS from the device on the PM port and the N bit in this FIS is 1, the controller sets the bit of this register corresponding to this port ID to 1.
The following describes the meaning of each bit by taking bit 3 as an example:
0: No async notification event occurs on the device whose PM port number is 3.
1: An async notification event occurs on the device whose PM port ID is 3.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_FBS
RegisterGroup.description: an FIS-based switching control register.

Member.name: fbs_dwe
Member.description: A fatal error occurs on the device corresponding to the current PM port. This field is configured by hardware and is valid only when PxFBS.SDE is 1.

Member.name: fbs_ado
Member.description: Maximum number of external devices mounted over the PM during the current FIS-based switching. This field is configured by hardware. The number of PM domains corresponding to the created command should be less than the value when a command is created for optimal performance.

Member.name: fbs_dev
Member.description: ID of the PM port to which the next command is transmitted. This field is configured by software. Software cannot transmit commands to multiple PM ports. Therefore, when a CI is created, commands cannot be transmitted to multiple PM ports. The same PM port must be used for a CI.

Member.name: fbs_sde
Member.description: When this field is set to 1, a fatal error occurs, and hardware considers that software processes this error first. This field is cleared by setting PxCMD.ST to 0. When PxFBS.DEC is set to 1 or PxCMD.ST is set to 0, the fbs_sde bit needs to be cleared.

Member.name: fbs_dec
Member.description: When software sets this bit to 1, the HBA needs to clear the error trigger conditions and clear the commands of the outstanding corresponding to the device including PxCI and PxSACT of the device. After hardware rectifies the error, the hardware must set this bit to 0. Writing 0 to this bit by using software has no effect. Software can set this bit to 1 only when PxFBS.EN and PxFBS.SDE are 1.

Member.name: fbs_en
Member.description: When this bit is set to 1, a PM is connected, and the HBA needs to enable FIB-based switching to communicate with the PM. When this bit is cleared, FIS-based switching is unavailable. Software can modify this bit only when PxCMD.ST is 0.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_FIFOTH

Member.name: mem_ctrl
Member.description:
Timing parameter for controlling the memory
[13:11]: EMAA in the corresponding memory
[14]: EMSA in the corresponding memory
[17:15]: EMAB in the corresponding memory

Member.name: hold_seagate_bug_en
Member.description: The test shows that some Seagate hard disks do not comply with the protocol. To be specific, CONTp is transmitted after primitives are transmitted once. This bug can be avoided by setting this bit to 1.

Member.name: link_rxfifo_th
Member.description: Flow control threshold for the link RX FIFO. During data reception, if the data amount in the DMAC FIFO is above the threshold, the controller starts to control the data flow.

RegisterGroup.name: SPICR0
RegisterGroup.description: SPI control register 0.

Member.name: scr
Member.description:
Serial clock rate, ranging from 0 to 255. The field value is used to calculate the SPI TX and RX bit rates. The formula is as follows: FSPICLK/[CPSDVSR x (1 + SCR)]
CPSDVSR is an even number ranging from 2 to 254, and is specified by configuring SPICPSR.

Member.name: sph
Member.description:
SPICLKOUT phase.
For details, see section 11.8.4 "Peripheral Bus Timings."

Member.name: spo
Member.description:
SPICLKOUT polarity.
For details, see section 11.8.4 "Peripheral Bus Timings."

Member.name: frf
Member.description:
Frame format.
00: Motorola SPI frame
01: TI synchronous serial frame
10: national microwire frame
11: reserved

Member.name: dss
Member.description:
Data bit width.
0011: 4 bits
1000: 9 bits
1101: 14 bits
0100: 5 bits
1001: 10 bits
1110: 15 bits
0101: 6 bits
1010: 11 bits
1111: 16 bits
0110: 7 bits
1011: 12 bits
0111: 8 bits
1100: 13 bits
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: SPICR1
RegisterGroup.description: SPI control register 1.

Member.name: waiten
Member.description:
Wait enable. This bit is valid when SPICR0[frf] is set to the national microwire frame format.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: waitval
Member.description: Number of waiting beats between read and write operations in national microwire frame format. When the waiten bit is 1 and the frame format is national microwire, this field is valid.

Member.name: bigend
Member.description:
Data endian mode.
0: little endian
1: big endian

Member.name: ms
Member.description:
Master or slave mode. This field can be changed only when the SPI is disabled.
0: master mode (default value)
1: reserved

Member.name: sse
Member.description:
SPI enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: lbm
Member.description:
Loopback mode.
0: The normal serial interface operation is enabled.
1: The output of the TX serial shift register internally connects to the input of the RX serial shift register.

RegisterGroup.name: SPIDR

Member.name: data

TX or RX FIFO.

If the number of data bits is less than 16, they must be right-aligned. The TX logic ignores the unused upper bits, and the RX logic aligns the data to the right.

RegisterGroup.name: SPIIMSC
RegisterGroup.description: SPIMSC is an interrupt mask register. The value 0 indicates that an interrupt is masked, andthe value 1 indicates that an interrupt is not masked.

Member.name: txim
Member.description:
TX FIFO interrupt mask.
0: masked when the TX FIFO is half empty or less
1: not masked when the TX FIFO is half empty or less

Member.name: rxim
Member.description:
RX FIFO interrupt mask.
0: masked when the RX FIFO is half empty or less
1: not masked when the RX FIFO is half empty or less

Member.name: rtim
Member.description:
RX timeout interrupt mask.
0: masked
1: not masked

Member.name: rorim
Member.description:
RX overrun interrupt mask.
0: masked
1: not masked
When the value is 1, the hardware stream control function is enabled. That is, when the RX FIFO is full, the SPI stops transmitting data.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_DR
RegisterGroup.description: a UART data register that stores the received data and data to be transmitted.The RX status can be queried by reading this register.

Member.name: oe
Member.description:
Overrun error.
0: No overrun error occurs.
1: An overrun error occurs. That is, a data segment is received when the RX FIFO is full.

Member.name: be
Member.description:
Break error.
0: No break error occurs.
1: A break error occurs. That is, the RX data input signal retains low longer than a full word transfer. A full word consists of a start bit, a data bit, a parity bit, and a stop bit.

Member.name: pe
Member.description:
Parity error.
0: No parity error occurs.
1: A parity error occurs.

Member.name: fe
Member.description:
Frame error.
0: No frame error occurs.
1: A frame error (namely, stop bit error) occurs.

Member.name: data
Member.description: Data to be transmitted or received.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_RSR
RegisterGroup.description:
an RX status register or error clear register.
  • It acts as the RX status register when being read.
  • It acts as the error clear register when being written.The RX status can also be obtained by reading UART_DR. The status information about thebreak, frame, and parity read from UART_DR has priority over that read from UART_RSR.That is, the status information in UART_DR changes faster than that in UART_RSR.
CAUTIONUART_RSR is reset when any value is written to it.

Member.name: oe
Member.description:
Overrun error.
0: No overrun error occurs.
1: An overrun error occurs.
When the FIFO is full, no data will be written to the FIFO and an overrun occurs in the shift register. Therefore, the contents in the FIFO are valid. In this case, the CPU must read the data immediately to spare the FIFO.

Member.name: be
Member.description:
Break error.
0: No break error occurs.
1: A break error occurs.
If the RX data input signal retains low longer than a full word transfer, a break error is considered. A full word consists of a start bit, data bit, parity bit, and stop bit.

Member.name: pe
Member.description:
Parity error.
0: No parity error occurs.
1: A parity error of the received data occurs.
In FIFO mode, the error is associated with the data at the top of the FIFO.

Member.name: fe
Member.description:
Frame error.
0: No frame error occurs.
1: An error occurs at the stop bit of the received data. The valid stop bit is 1.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_FR
RegisterGroup.description: a UART flag register.

Member.name: txfe
Member.description:
The bit definition depends on the status of UART_LCR_H[fen].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, the bit is set to 1 when the TX holding register is empty.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, the bit is set to 1 when the TX FIFO is empty.

Member.name: rxff
Member.description:
The bit definition depends on the status of UART_LCR_H[fen].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, the bit is set to 1 when the RX holding register is full.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the RX FIFO is full.

Member.name: txff
Member.description:
The bit definition depends on the status of UART_LCR_H[fen].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, the bit is set to 1 when the TX holding register is full.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, the bit is set to 1 when the TX FIFO is full.

Member.name: rxfe
Member.description:
The bit definition depends on the status of UART_LCR_H[fen].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, the bit is set to 1 when the RX holding register is empty.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the RX FIFO is empty.

Member.name: busy
Member.description:
UART busy/idle status.
0: The UART is idle or data transmission is complete.
1: The UART is busy in transmitting data.
If the bit is set to 1, the status is retained until the entire byte (including all stop bits) is transmitted from the shift register.
Regardless of whether the UART is enabled, this bit is set to 1 when the TX FIFO is not empty.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_IBRD
RegisterGroup.description: an integer baud rate register.

Member.name: bauddivint
Member.description: Clock divider corresponding to the integral part of the baud rate. All bits are cleared after reset.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_FBRD
RegisterGroup.description:
a decimal baud rate register.CAUTION
  • The values of UART_IBRD and UART_FBRD can be updated only after the current datais transmitted and received completely.
  • The minimum clock divider is 1, and the maximum clock divider is 65,535 (216 ? 1). Thatis, UART_IBRD cannot be 0 and UART_FBRD is ignored in this case. If UART_FBRD isset to 0x1E and UART_IBRD is set to 0x01, the integral part of the clock divider is 30 andthe decimal part of the clock divider is 0.015625. Therefore, the clock divider is30.015625.
  • UART baud rate = Internal bus frequency/(16 x Clock divider) = Internal busfrequency/(16 x 30.015625)

Member.name: banddivfrac
Member.description: Clock divider corresponding to the decimal part of the baud rate. All bits are cleared after reset.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_LCR_H
RegisterGroup.description: a transfer mode control register. The registers UART_LCR_H,UART_FBRD are updated, UART_LCR_H must be also updated.Total Reset Value

Member.name: sps
Member.description:
Parity select.
When bit 1, bit 2, and bit 7 of this register are set to 1, the parity bit is 0 during transmission and detection.
When bit 1 and bit 7 are set to 1 and bit 2 is set to 0, the parity bit is 1 during transmission and detection.
When bit 1, bit 2, and bit 7 are cleared, the stick parity bit is disabled.

Member.name: wlen
Member.description:
Count of bits in a transmitted or received frame.
00: 5 bits
01: 6 bits
10: 7 bits
11: 8 bits

Member.name: fen
Member.description:
TX/RX FIFO enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: stp2
Member.description:
2-bit stop bit at the end of a transmitted frame.
0: There is no a 2-bit stop bit at the end of the transmitted frame.
1: There is a 2-bit stop bit at the end of the transmitted frame.
The RX logic does not check for the 2-bit stop bit during data reception.

Member.name: eps
Member.description:
Parity select during data transmission and reception.
0: The odd parity is generated or performed during data transmission and reception.
1: The even parity is generated or performed during data transmission and reception.
When UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is invalid.

Member.name: pen
Member.description:
Parity enable.
0: The parity is disabled.
1: The parity is generated at the TX side and performed at the RX side.

Member.name: brk
Member.description:
Break TX.
0: invalid
1: After the current data transmission is complete, the UTXD outputs a low level continuously.
Note: This bit must retain 1 during the period of at least two full frames to ensure the break command is executed properly. In normal cases, the bit must be set to 0.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_CR
RegisterGroup.description: a UART control register.To configure UART_CR, perform the following steps:Write 0 to UART_CR[uarten] to disable the UART.Wait until the current data transmission or reception is complete.Set UART_LCR_H[fen] to 0.Configure UART_CR.Write 1 to UART_CR[uarten] to enable the UART.----End

Member.name: ctsen
Member.description:
CTS hardware flow control enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled. The data can be transmitted only when the nUARTCTS signal is valid.

Member.name: rtsen
Member.description:
RTS hardware flow control enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled. The data RX request can be sent only when the RX FIFO has free space.

Member.name: rts
Member.description:
Request TX.
This bit is the inversion of the status output signal nUARTRTS of the UART modem.
0: The output signal is retained.
1: When this bit is set to 1, the output signal is 0.

Member.name: dtr
Member.description:
Data TX ready.
This bit is the inversion of the status output signal nUARTDTR of the UART modem.
0: The output signal is retained.
1: When this bit is set to 1, the output signal is 0.

Member.name: rxe
Member.description:
UART RX enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
If the UART is disabled during data reception, the current data reception is stopped abnormally.

Member.name: txe
Member.description:
UART TX enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
If the UART is disabled during data transmission, the current data transmission is stopped abnormally.

Member.name: lbe
Member.description:
Loopback enable.
0: disabled
1: UARTTXD output is looped back to UARTRXD.

Member.name: uarten
Member.description:
UART enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
If the UART is disabled during data reception and transmission, the data transfer is stopped abnormally.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_IFLS

Member.name: rxiflsel
Member.description:
RX interrupt FIFO threshold select. An RX interrupt is triggered when any of the following conditions is met:
000: RX FIFO ≥ 1/8 x full
001: RX FIFO ≥ 1/4 x full
010: RX FIFO ≥ 1/2 x full
011: RX FIFO ≥ 3/4 x full
100: RX FIFO ≥ 7/8 x full
101?111: reserved

Member.name: txiflsel
Member.description:
TX interrupt FIFO threshold select. A TX interrupt is triggered when any of the following conditions is met:
000: TX FIFO ≤ 1/8 x full
001: TX FIFO ≤ 1/4 x full
011: TX FIFO ≤ 3/4 x full
010: TX FIFO ≤ 1/2 x full
100: TX FIFO ≤ 7/8 x full
101?111: reserved

0: USB 2.0 high-speed UTMI+ or ULPI PHY
1: USB 1.1 full-speed serial transceiver
If the USB 1.1 full-speed serial transceiver is not selected, this bit is always 0 and write-only.
If the USB 2.0 high-speed PHY is not selected, this bit is always 1 and read-only.
If the preceding interface types are not selected (non-zero value), this bit is used to select the interface to be activated, and this bit can be read or written.

1: 3-pin bidirectional full-speed serial interface

If the USB 1.1 full-speed interface is selected, this bit can be used to select the 3-pin or 6-pin interface and can be read or written.

RegisterGroup.name: GRSTCTL
RegisterGroup.description: a reset hardware feature register.

Member.name: ahbidle
Member.description: AHB master idle, indicating whether the AHB master state machine is idle.

Member.name: dmareq
Member.description: DMA request signal, indicating that the DMA request is in progress. This bit is only for debugging.

Member.name: txfnum
Member.description:
TX FIFO ID.
0x0:
In host mode, non-periodic TX FIFOs are flushed.
During shared FIFO operations, non-periodic TX FIFOs are flushed in device mode.
In dedicated FIFO mode, TX FIFO 0 is flushed in device mode.
0x1:
In host mode, periodic TX FIFOs are flushed.
During shared FIFO operations, periodic TX FIFO 1 is flushed in device mode.
In dedicated FIFO mode, TX FIFO 1 is flushed in device mode.
0x2:
During shared FIFO operations, periodic TX FIFO 2 is flushed in device mode.
In dedicated FIFO mode, TX FIFO 2 is flushed in device mode.
...
0xF:
During shared FIFO operations, periodic TX FIFO 15 is flushed in device mode.
In dedicated FIFO mode, TX FIFO 15 is flushed in device mode.
0x10:
All TX FIFOs are flushed in device or host mode.

Member.name: txfflsh
Member.description:
TX FIFO flush.
This bit can be used to refresh one or all TX FIFOs but FIFOs cannot be flushed during transaction.

Member.name: rxfflsh
Member.description:
RX FIFO flush.
This bit can be used to refresh all RX FIFOs.

Member.name: intknqflsh
Member.description:
In token sequence learning queue flush.
This bit is valid only when OTG_EN_DED_TX_FIFO is 0.

Member.name: frmcntrrst
Member.description:
Host frame counter reset.
This bit is used to reset the frame number counter. When the frame number counter is reset, the number of SOF frames is 0.

Member.name: csftrst
Member.description:
Core soft interrupt.
1) All interrupts and the CSR register excluding the following bits are cleared:
- PCGCCTL.RstPdwnModule
- PCGCCTL.GateHclk
- PCGCCTL.PwrClmp
- PCGCCTL.StopPPhyLPwrClkSelclk
- GUSBCFG.PhyLPwrClkSel
- GUSBCFG.DDRSel
- GUSBCFG.PHYSel
- GUSBCFG.FSIntf
- GUSBCFG.ULPI_UTMI_Sel
- GUSBCFG.PHYIf
- GUSBCFG.TxEndDelay
- GUSBCFG.TermSelDLPulse
- GUSBCFG.ULPIClkSusM
- GUSBCFG.ULPIAutoRes
- GUSBCFG.ULPIFsLs
- GGPIO
- GPWRDN
- GADPCTL
- HCFG.FSLSPclkSel
- DCFG.DevSpd
- DCTL.SftDiscon
2) All module state machines are reset to the idle status, and all TX FIFOs and RX FIFOs are cleared.
3) All transactions on the AHB master are interrupted as soon as possible, and all USB transactions are immediately interrupted.
4) When the hibernation or ADP feature is enabled, the PMU module is not soft-reset by the core.

RegisterGroup.name: GINTSTS
RegisterGroup.description: a system interrupt register.

Member.name: wkupint
Member.description: Suspend/Resume detection interrupt. Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: sessreqint
Member.description:
In host mode, an interrupt is generated when a device session request is detected.
In device mode, an interrupt is generated when utmisrp_bvalid is 1.
Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: disconnint
Member.description:
An interrupt is generated when the system detects that the device is disconnected.
Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: conidstschng
Member.description:
An interrupt is generated when the slot ID changes.
Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: lpm_int
Member.description:
In device mode, an interrupt is generated when the device receives an LPM transaction and transmits a response indicating no errors.
In host mode, an interrupt is generated when the device receives an LPM transaction and transmits a response indicating no errors, or when the host core completes the preset LPM transactions.
Note: This bit is valid only when LPMCapable or OTG_ENABLE_LPM is 1.
Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: ptxfemp
Member.description: An interrupt is generated when the periodic TX FIFO is empty or half empty.

Member.name: hchint
Member.description:
In host mode, an interrupt is generated in a core channel.
This bit is cleared by clearing the corresponding status bit.

Member.name: prtint
Member.description:
In host mode, an interrupt is generated when the status of a port of the DWC_otg core changes.
Note: This bit is cleared by clearing the corresponding bit in the host port control and status register.

Member.name: resetdet
Member.description:
In device mode, an interrupt is generated when the device is suspended and the system detects that the USB module is reset in power-down module. In host mode, this interrupt is not generated.
Note: Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: fetsusp
Member.description: This interrupt is valid only in DMA mode. This interrupt indicates that the core stops obtaining data from IN endpoints.

Member.name: incomplpincompisoout
Member.description:
In host mode, an interrupt is generated if there are pending transactions.
In device mode, an interrupt is generated when there are isochronous OUT transfers to be completed.
Note: Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: incompisoin
Member.description:
An interrupt is generated when there are isochronous IN transfers to be completed.
In scatter/gather DMA mode, this interrupt is not generated.
Note: Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: oepint
Member.description: In device mode, an interrupt is generated on an OUT endpoint. This interrupt is cleared by clearing the corresponding status bit in the DOEPINTn register.

Member.name: iepint
Member.description: In device mode, an interrupt is generated on an IN endpoint. This interrupt is cleared by clearing the corresponding status bit in the DOEPINTn register.

Member.name: epmis
Member.description:
An interrupt is generated when endpoints mismatch. This bit is valid only during shared FIFO operations.
Note: Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: rstrdoneint

An interrupt is caused by the restore command after hibernation.
Note: This bit is valid only when the hibernation function is enabled.

Member.name: eopf
Member.description:
Periodic frame end interrupt.
Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: isooutdrop
Member.description:
Isochronous OUT packet drop interrupt.
Note: Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt

Member.name: enumdone
Member.description:
Speed enumeration completion interrupt.
Note: Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: usbrst
Member.description:
USB reset detection interrupt.
Note: Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: usbsusp
Member.description:
USB suspend detection interrupt.
Note: Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: erlysusp
Member.description:
USB idle 3 ms detection interrupt.
Note: Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: i2cint
Member.description:
An interrupt is generated when I2C access through the I2C interface is complete.
This bit is enabled only when OTG_I2C_INTERFACE is 1.
Note: Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: ulpickinti2cckint
Member.description:
When the ULPI Carkit interrupt is generated, the core sets the interrupt bit to 1.
This bit is valid only when OTG_ULPI_CARKIT is 1; otherwise, reading this bit returns 0.
When the I2C Carkit interrupt is generated, the core sets the interrupt bit to 1.
This bit is valid only when OTG_I2C_INTERFACE is 1; otherwise, reading this bit returns 0.
Note: Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: goutnakeff
Member.description: The global OUT NAK bit in the device control register is set. This interrupt is cleared by clearing the global OUT NAK bit.

Member.name: ginnakeff
Member.description: An interrupt is generated when the global non-periodic IN NAK is set in the device control register.

Member.name: nptxfemp
Member.description: An interrupt is generated when the non-periodic TX FIFO is empty or half empty.

Member.name: rxflvl
Member.description: There is at least a pending packet to be read by the RX FIFO.

Member.name: sof
Member.description:
In host mode, an SOF, micro-SOF, or keep-active is being transmitted.
In device mode, an SOF token is received by the USB module.

Member.name: otgint
Member.description:
An OTG even is in progress.
This interrupt is cleared by clearing the corresponding bit in the GOTGINT register.

Member.name: modemis
Member.description:
Mode mismatch interrupt.
When the core works in device mode, a register in host mode needs to be accessed.
When the core works in host mode, a register in device mode needs to be accessed.
Note: Setting this bit to 1 clears this interrupt.

Member.name: curmod
Member.description:
Current mode.
0: device mode
1: host mode

Member.name: nptxqtop

Non-periodic TX request queue top.
Bit[30:27]: number of channels or endpoints
bit[26:25]:
00: IN/OUT token

11: channel stop command
Bit[24]: stop (the selected channel or endpoint is used for attempting)

Available space for the non-periodic TX request queue.
0x0: The non-periodic TX request queue is full.
0x1: One location is available.
0x2: Two locations are available.
0xn: n locations (0 ≤ n ≤ 8) are available.
Other values: reserved

Member.name: nptxfspcavail
Member.description:
Total available space for the non-periodic TX request queue.
0x0: The non-periodic TX FIFO is Full.
0x1: One word is available.
0x2: Two words available.
0xn: n words (0 ≤ n ≤ 32,768) are available.
0x8000: 32,768 words are available.
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: GLPMCFG

Member.name: invselhsic
Member.description:
HSIC select (by using HSIC-invert)enable.
If if_sel_hsic is 1:
1: disabled
0: enabled
If if_sel_hsic is 0:
1: enabled
0: disabled

Member.name: hsiccon
Member.description:
HSIC-connect.
Host mode: When this bit is set to 1, the bus HSIC is driven to idle status and waits for the HSIC connect sequence transmitted from the device.
Device mode: When this bit is set to 1, the device waits from the HSIC idle line state on the bus. The HSIC connection starts after the idle line state occurs.
Note: This bit is valid only when OTG_ENABLE_HSIC is 1; otherwise, reading this bit returns 0.

1: The core enters the deep sleep mode.

In device mode, this field reflects the response to the LPM transaction.
In host mode, this field indicates the handshake response from the device during LPM transaction.
11: ACK
10: NYET
01: STALL
00: error (no handshake response)

Member.name: enblslpm

utmi_sleep_n enable.

1: enabled

Member.name: bremotewake
Member.description:
Remote wake enable.
In host mode, the enable signal is transmitted from the wIndex field of the LPM transaction.
In device mode (read-only), when the ACK, NYET, or STALL response is transmitted to the LPM transaction, this bit is updated together with the received LPM token, bRemoteWake, and bmAttribute.

Member.name: hird
Member.description:
When EnBESL is 0:
Host-initiated resume period.
In host mode, this field is assigned by the LPM transaction.
In device mode, this field is updated by LPM token HIRD bmAttribute.
Sl. No HIRD[3:0] THIRD (μs)
1 4'b0000 50
2 4'b0001 125
3 4'b0010 200
4 4'b0011 275
5 4'b0100 350
6 4'b0101 425
7 4'b0110 500
8 4'b0111 575
9 4'b1000 650
10 4'b1001 725
11 4'b1010 800
12 4'b1011 875
13 4'b1100 950
14 4'b1101 1025
15 4'b1110 1100
16 4'b1111 1175
When EnBESL is 1:
In host mode, the BESL value is transmitted to the LPM transaction
In device mode, this field is updated by LPM token BESL bmAttribute.

Member.name: TxfifoUndrn_OutPktErr
Member.description:
FIFO underrun interrupt.
An interrupt is generated when the FIFO underrun conditions are transmitted.
The interrupt is valid when the following conditions are met:
- OTG_EN_DED_TX_FIFO = 1
- Thresholding enabled
OUT packet error.
An interrupt is generated when an overrun or CRC error is detected.
The interrupt is valid when the following conditions are met:
- OTG_EN_DED_TX_FIFO = 1
- Thresholding enabled

Member.name: TxFEmp
Member.description:
TX FIFO empty status interrupt.
An interrupt is generated when the TX FIFO is empty or half empty.
Note: This bit is valid only for IN endpoints.
0: An interrupt is cleared.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: INEPNakEff_Back2BackSETup
Member.description:
IN endpoint NAK effective interrupt.
An interrupt is generated when the IN endpoint bit is set.
Back-to-back setup package received interrupt.
An interrupt is generated when the core receives more than three back-to-back setup packets.
0: An interrupt is cleared.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: INTknEPMis_StsPhseRcvd
Member.description:
An interrupt is generated when the IN tokens with mismatch EP are received.
Control write pulse is received.
0: An interrupt is cleared.
1: A control write pulse is received.

Member.name: INTknTXFEmp_OUTTknEPdis
Member.description:
An interrupt is generated if IN tokens are received when the corresponding TX FIFO is empty.
An interrupt is generated if OUT tokens are received when endpoints are disabled.
0: An interrupt is cleared.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: TimeOUT_SetUp
Member.description:
Timeout interrupt.
An interrupt is generated when timeout conditions are detected.

1: An interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: INSNREG00
RegisterGroup.description: a micro-frame length configuration register.

Member.name: debug
Member.description: For debugging only.

Member.name: val
Member.description: Micro-frame counter. This field is used only for simulation. In normal cases, the micro-frame length is 125 μs defined in the protocol. During simulation, the micro-frame length can be shorted by configuring this field to reduce the simulation time.

Member.name: en
Member.description:
Enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: INSNREG01
RegisterGroup.description: INTNREG01 is a PBUF out/in threshold register.

Member.name: out_threshold
Member.description: TX threshold. If the data amount in the PBUF is above the TX threshold, data starts to be transmitted. The threshold is measured by 32 bits.

Member.name: in_threshold
Member.description: RX threshold. If the data amount in the PBUF is above the RX threshold, data is read from the PBUF. The threshold is measured by 32 bits.

RegisterGroup.name: INSNREG02
RegisterGroup.description: a PBUF depth configuration register.

Member.name: pbuf_depth
Member.description: PBUF depth. The depth is measured by 32 bits.

Member.name: dis
Member.description:
256 MHz clock check enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ctrl

Member.name: val
Member.description: TX-TX turnaround delay addition.

Member.name: fetch
Member.description: Periodic frames list RX.

Member.name: offset
Member.description: Available time offset.

Member.name: brk_en
Member.description:
Interrupt memory transfer enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: INSNREG04

Member.name: auto_en
Member.description:
Automatic feature enable.
0: enabled. The suspend signal is valid when the run/stop bit is reset by software, but the hchalted bit is not set.
1: disabled. The port is not suspended when software clears the run/stop bit.
The default value is 0.

Member.name: nak_reldfix_en
Member.description:
NAK reload enable.
0: enabled
1: disabled

Member.name: scaledwn_enum_time

1: enabled

1: enabled

Member.name: hcsparam_en

0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: ioshare_reg0

Member.name: io_drive_cfg
Member.description:
PAD drive current
00: 4 mA
01: 8 mA
10: 12 mA
11: 24 mA
When this pin is multiplexed as the SDIO0_CCLK_OUT pin:
01 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB when the voltage is 3.3 V.
10 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB when the voltage is 1.8 V.
11 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB.
When this pin is multiplexed as other pins, 00 is recommended.

Member.name: io_drive_cfg
Member.description:
PAD drive current
000: 4 mA
001: 6 mA
010: 8 mA
011: 10 mA
100: 12 mA
101: 14 mA
110: 16 mA
111: 18 mA
When this pin is multiplexed as the NF_CSN1 pin:
000 is recommended for the async mode.
000 is recommended for the sync mode when the voltage is 3.3 V.
001 is recommended for the sync mode when the voltage is 1.8 V.
When this pin is multiplexed as the NF_REC pin:
010 is recommended for the async mode.
001 is recommended for the 2-layer PCB, and 010 is recommended for the 4-layer PCB in sync mode when the voltage is 3.3 V.
110 is recommended for the sync mode when the voltage is 1.8 V.
When this pin is multiplexed as other pins, 000 is recommended.
